inn1.comm: full and swinging away outside off, too far, wide
full and straight, blocked on the crease
little wider of of the off stump on a similar length, left alone
little fuller, draws the batsman forward on off stump, who defends solidly into the covers
this one shapes into Watling but it was far enough outside off stump to shoulder arms again
drives at this on a similar line, on the bounce to a leaping cover fieldsman
forward again, played with soft hands this and guided down to third man to get the innings underway
I reckon this new run up is quite good, bit of a snorter, rears up and nips away, the batsman does well to keep inside it
this is much fuller and nips back into the right-hander who was playing forward and got a thick inside edge to the on side
another beaut, good length and nips away this time by 1.6 degrees, Watling playing and missing

another ball that nips, this time away, Watling fends at it and finds second slip. He was very uncomfortable in the opening three balls and was playing awkwardly away from his body to a good length ball that bounced on him, took the shoulder of the bat and it was simple as you like for the fielder
inbehind a ball a little too straight and tucked through square leg
good length just outside off, pressed into the covers
just outside off stump and left alone to a full length
played forward off the outer half of the bat to third man, heavens that is close
good length on off stump, angled towards point
firm drive to cover, Morgan dives and saves well
slides past the outside edge, no real foot movement, angles across the left-hander, well bowled
middle and leg on a full length, tucked to midwicket
bumper, ducked well
and another, so no more bouncers for the other four balls
full and middle stump, pushed on the front foot into the gap at midwicket
length around leg stump, Rutherford can't turn it away through the leg side
firm drive into the covers from just outside off, Ian Bell this time gets down and saves with one hand
full and played into the covers from off stump
driven solidly towards mid off, again no runs
front foot drive fielded at cover
little wider of off stump and Rutherford chases it, gets beaten by a hint of movement away from the bat
drifts into the pads and gets tucked down to long leg
overpitched and caressed down the ground, that was four on any ground but today it's four before anyone can start clapping, fine piece of timing
goes for the on drive again but finds the fielder, probably missed out
good length, back foot and punched towards cover point
front foot this time to the same fielder at point
beaten for pace here, went to try and cut I think, then realised it was too straight and just let it hit the splice of the bat, managed to get it towards point on the ground
now steps away and tries to flay a length ball over the off side, missed by a mile
good length and straight, blocked on the crease
defended on the back foot into the on side
good length and Williamson, with his height, able to hang back and punch towards mid off
little wider of off stump, comes forward this time and drives well but not past a diving Bell at cover

tight line, played tentatively, edged and gone taken by the keeper. Persistence so often rewarded for Anderson. Williamson went nowhere with the feet, pushed at the good length delivery just outside off, and got a feather edge to Buttler
straight line, blocked back up the wicket from the crease
similar line, tucked towards the on side
even more towards the pads, flicked at, comes off the pad to the keeper
off stump, blocked towards point on the front foot

well wide of off stump, flashed at, nicked and Buttler takes his second straightforward catch. Probably the worst ball Finn has sent down so far and Rutherford, in his eagerness, threw the kitchen sink at it but failed to move his feet and got a thick edge
just outside off on a full length, left alone
tighter to off stump, Elliot is forward and pressing towards point
bumper, leg side ish...no wide though
back of a length, nips back a little too, comes off the body towards gully
middle and leg line on a full length, tucked to midwicket
just outside off and played into the covers on the front foot
tighter line to off stump, played largely from the crease back up the wicket
little straighter and worked to midwicket, good save from Root
played towards the same fielder from another full length ball
Anderson tries a short one, bad idea, hooked for four, very well controlled, chops is with a downward motion of the bat, timed superbly in front of square
good length ball, left alone outside off on bounce, went close to the off peg
fuller on a similar line, played forward into the covers
bumper and this is called wide, it drift to leg, according to Mr Ravi it did
back of a length, dropped into the off side from around middle and off
back of a length again, a little too straight, worked down to long leg
too straight again, comes off the pad to long leg
better line, around middle and leg, blocked back to the bowler
length ball, straightening a touch outside off, blocked back down the track
ooh, that's a peach, good length and nibbling away off the surface, beats the outside edge as Taylor dangles his bat out
beaten again, and this time there's a noise ... but it was possibly just bat on pad, Taylor pushing forward as the ball nipped through
straighter line this time, no swing and clipped firmly through midwicket for a single
good length, slightly wide of the stumps and Elliott is happy to wave it through
pitched up a little fuller but too straight and worked off the front pad through midwicket
back of a length in the channel and defended
goes across and pushes a short ball defensively towards point
tight line, beats the bat outside off as Elliott throws his hands at the ball
lovely shot from Elliott for a lesser-spotted boundary, leaning out and opening the face, not quite to the pitch but neatly steered through backward point and beating third man
drags his length back, blocked into the off side
full and straight and worked to midwicket
good line and length in the corridor from Woakes, left alone by the batsman
pitched up on middle stumps, closes the face and turns through the leg side to the sweeper
full and drifting in towards the stumps, clipped to mid-on coming forward
angled in and holding its line on a good length, defended on the back foot with an exaggerated stance in front of off
length ball, outside off and pushed towards cover
straighter line, gets across and turns the ball to a shortish midwicket, no run
pitched up and and pushed out towards point
goes back and opens the face, steering a single down to third man
overpitched and Taylor pings this down the ground, lovely hands and he just leans on it to drive fine of mid-on
shortish and played on the back foot into the off side
Broad goes full, drawing the drive but there's no movement and Taylor cracks a drive that would go screaming through the covers were it not for a diving stop from Ian Bell
length, wide of off and, what do you know, it draws the edge ... but there was plenty on it and it would have gone wide of second slip, even, for a single to third man
on the stumps, touch full and turned through backward square, not quite where Taylor was aiming but it rolls into a gap and they run hard for two
dug in short this time, he's quickly back to roll the wrists on a swivel-pull through square leg
defends on the back foot into the off side
gets forward to push towards mid-on on the full
turns into the leg side from in front of the stumps
short of a good length and outside off stump, chopped towards point from the crease
tossed up and steered through point on the front foot
tossed up outside off, tapped back
well, maybe they are going to give it some tap against Swann, Elliott skipping out to loft over the infield out towards deep cover
Taylor goes back and opens the face this time, steering a couple to third man
flatter, on the stumps and worked off the pads to midwicket
pushed through on middle again, Taylor can't beat the man at midwicket
length ball, on the stumps and dabbed into the leg side
banged in short and that climbs well over Elliott's head - I didn't know Woakes was capable of that
little bit of width, Elliott goes back and cuts a length ball through backward point
touch short, at the batsman, who stays in the crease and defends in front of middle
steps back and plays a length ball through the covers from outside off
this time we are in business, Taylor working a length ball towards midwicket
goes back and drives on the up back towards the bowler, Woakes does well to stop it in his follow-through
tossed up outside off, Elliott stays back and guides the ball straight to short third man
beaten in the flight this time, tries to get forward and hit down the ground but it comes high off the bat and loops wide of Swann, they pick up a single as the ball runs through mid-on
floated up on the stumps and nudged through the midwicket region
full and wide of the off stump, driven with a flourish but picks out cover
tossed up and work through leg
angled in, bit of drift towards middle and off, gets forward to clip a single to long-on
length ball on the stumps, punched back and Woakes cuts it off again
good length, can't get this away throuh point
good bumper this, not too high and zinging through outside off, Taylor swatted at it but missed
tip and run towards mid-on, Taylor advancing and pre-meditating a quick single, he's quick enough to get through and a ripple of applause goes around - that's the NZ fifty
bit of width and Elliott hammers a cut shot towards backward point, where Morgan throws himself to stop the ball (and a run)
on the stumps, tapped short on the leg side and the scamper another
sliding in, flat and on the stumps, turned to short fine leg and they can't chance one there
tossed up and again nudged behind square to the fielder on the leg side
full and flighted, on the stumps, Elliott goes down on one knee and sweeps hard - again he picks out backward square
tossed up and punched down the ground on the walk, he gets the single to long-on instead
on the stumps, worked through midwicket with a turn of the wrists
flat and slight wide of off, Elliott is quickly out of the crease and he chips the ball over extra-cover, nicely played and that will beat the sweeper
touch short of a length, blocked back down the track from in front of the stumps
pitched up a little more, gets on the front foot and punches to mid-off
full and straight, dabbed short of mid-on and Taylor goes haring off again, Cook goes underarm at the stumps but misses
bouncer, well directed and Elliott ducks underneath
fullish, tempting Elliott outside off, he slices a single down to third man playing away from his body
full and wide, Taylor comes forward and tries to steer it through point but gets an inside edge on to his pads, Broad cleans up
wide of the off stump, tries to reverse sweep but can't get it away
tossed up and turned short on the leg side
flighted, spinning back from outside off and Elliott is hit on the front pad trying to sweep - but it wasn't in line, despite Swann's appeal
comes forward and gets a single down the ground
pushed through on the stumps, played back towards mid-on
turned through midwicket for a single - and that's the fifty partnership
length ball outside off, chops cross-batted through cover
length ball, on middle and off, worked into the leg side but can't beat the infield
another thick edge through the vacant slip area, quite wide and it runs down to third man

oh no, Taylor has sent Elliott down the Swannee here - New Zealand have lost their fourth wicket via a hapless run-out! Taylor turned through backward square leg, set off in pursuit of two and then changed his mind a third of the way down the track, abandoning Elliott as the throw came in. Holy moly me oh my - New Zealand did not need that
on the stumps, played towards mid-on
goes back and across to his first ball and chops into the covers, calls "Yes, no!" and this time Taylor has to go scrambling back
touch short, played on the back foot towards point
gets forward and manages to steer the ball in front of square for a single
short of a good length and angling in, stays in the crease and jabs to point
beaten, a cavalier drive against a fullish ball on the up and McCullum carves out a chunk of fresh air
length outside off, comes forward and pushes to mid-off
defended into the off side on the back foot
full and on off, gets forward and turns to midwicket
pitched up on middle and off, closes the face and turns through a gap in the leg side
length and in the channel, McCullum still circumspect and defends on the front foot
gets across and blocks into the off side
short and straying towards leg stump, McCullum nudges the ball off his hips and picks up one to long leg

slightly wide, swishes and nicked! Or did he? Taylor has called for the review... There was definitely a noise but Hot Spot is looking a little inconclusive. There's a smudge on the toe of the bat, looks like he might have just got the cue end on it... And the decision stands, the third umpire deciding there wasn't enough evidence to overturn the on-field call! Taylor has junked his promising innings and England are eyeing the underbelly
goes back and plays into the off side with a horizontal bat
back of a length, tapped towards mid-off
ripper, that's fired through off a shortish length, McCullum throwing the bat and getting away with it
straighter line, McCullum gets in a bit of a tangle but blocks in front of the stumps
length and pushed square on the off side
full and outside off, driven on the front foot into the covers but cut off
back of a length and on leg stump to the left-handed Franklin, he turns it square
length, angled across and chopped into the covers
line and length, stays back and taps towards mid-off
dug in short, at the body and Franklin bobs and weaves under it
short of a good length, defended in front of the stumps
shuffles across and tucks a length ball off the pads through square leg
round the wicket, angled in and pushed back down the track
flat and sliding in, Franklin closes the face and works on through midwicket
tossed up, played with the turn to leg but can't beat the fielder
touch short, on middle and leg, McCullum goes back and pulls flat through square leg
pushed through and turned round the corner but straight to short fine leg
tossed up and straightening around off, solid forward defensive back to the bowler
length ball on off stump, McCullum defends back to the bowler
pitched up and nicely timed back down the ground, looks like four all the way but Cook gallops after it from mid-off and pulls it in short
good length, blocked on the front foot
straight, short of a length, McCullum hops across and swats the ball firmly to deep backward square leg
short and on leg stump, Franklin scoops the ball over backward square to the man in the deep
tight line and McCullum shows it the face of the bat in defence
round the wicket, tossed up around off, pushed back down the ground on the front foot for one
tossed up and pushed back for a single to long-on
slightly flat and on middle, clipped through midwicket
gets forward to defend on the front foot
flatter, angling in towards the stumps, worked to the fielder at midwicket
flighted around off stump, pushed to long-on
length ball, coming back in a touch, pushed into the on side with a turn of the wrists and they get one
on the stumps, defended back down the track
little bit of width, played on the up with a swing of the arms through the covers, well timed but it won't quite run all the way
length ball, gets forward and pushes through the covers
stays in the crease and dabs towards cover, there's another yes/no episode and McCullum does a u-ey to get back in his crease
tight line, defended into the off side
tossed up on off stump and pushed back to the bowler
fired in a bit quicker on middle and McCullum squeezes it out short on the leg side
flat and angled in as McCullum goes walking, digging the ball out for a single to long-on
floated up and punched down the ground from the crease
and finally, McCullum has had enough of scratching around, he takes a couple of steps and bunts the ball a good way back over long-on - that's six on most grounds, never mind the short boundary
drags his length down in response and McCullum is quickly back to muscle a flat pull to the man on the deep midwicket boundary
length ball outside off, taken through the covers on the up
touch fuller, dropped short of point who comes tearing in to prevent one
angled across on a good length, tries to free the arms but can't force the ball past mid-off
banged in but just a touch too much bang and it's a wide on height
lovely ball, a real teaser in the channel and Franklin plays and misses
tight line on off stump, pushed back to mid-off, another dot ball in what has been a pointillist masterpiece from England so far
on the stumps, worked off the hips through square leg for a single
round the wicket, pushed through slightly wide and Franklin steers a back-foot drive through a gap at cover
gets across and works one through the leg side
tossed up, straightening on off, defended towards point

chipped back, Swann dives ... and got him! Not only has he gone relatively unscathed on what was billed as a "spinners' graveyard", he's got his 100th ODI wicket into the bargain. Franklin played the ball off the back foot, was nowhere near the pitch, it may have stuck in the surface slightly before looping off the bat and Swann fell to his right to bag it safely
angled in, gets across and works one through midwicket to bring up the hundred - there's a smattering of cheers (maybe jeers?) around the ground
tossed up and nudged towards mid-on
lovely ball to being with, seaming back just a touch off a good length and beating the inside edge on its way through to the keeper
slightly shorter, gets across and manages to steer it through point with an open face
short and just outside off, not much room to swing the arms and he picks out cover
full and slightly wide, McCullum gets out to turn it into a half-volley and laces the ball between extra-cover and mid-off for an exquisite boundary
good length and outside off stump, McCullum comes forward and nudges through the gap to the cover sweeper
on the walk, pushed back towards mid-on
short of a length and outside off, guided through point
straighter line, slightly back of a length and Nathan McCullum works it off his hips wide of fine leg for a couple
McCullum shuffles across again and tries to glance to the same part of the ground, he fails to connect and the ball sails over the top of leg
nearly plays on, short and on off stump, McCullum defends on the back foot into the ground and it bounces down and up, narrowly missing the bails

but he's gone this time, nicking off to slip! Finn has been almost unplayable today, even if you know roughly where he's going to put it - this was in the channel, quick and holding its line as McCullum moved across and fenced tamely at the ball, perhaps thinking about going to leg initially but now only going back to the pavillion
short and taken on the back foot down to third man
pitched up and pushed back towards mid-on
pitched up, defended into the ground and it runs through towards the slips
length ball in the corridor, blocked into the turf again, it rolls away on the off side and they manage to get McCullum back on strike
gets across and pushes a length ball into the off side
pitched up and pushed in front of point for a single
full and slightly wide, Ellis skips forward and opens his shoulders, gets plenty of bat on this and it pierces the infield, running away for four to deep cover
pitched up in the channel, again the batsman comes forward and slices into the off side, picks out a fielder but it's not a straightforward take and they get one
touch short of a length, outside off and guided down to third man
smashing shot from McCullum, who's running out of partners and decides to get a wriggle on, seizing on a short ball and pulling it flat in front of deep square leg
that's even better, sweet timing from McCullum as he crashes a hook through deep midwicket with a flash of the wrists
and now he launches Finn back down the ground, he knew the full ball was coming and he clubbed it back over long-off for the second six of the innings
dug in short, McCullum had hopped across and he lets this go down the leg side - that'll be a wide
short and outside off this time, McCullum decides to go easy on Finn and lets this one through
full and veering down the leg side, Anderson screams out at appeal but that was swinging too far
goes back and steers a short ball behind square on the off side
back of a length again, dropped towards square leg and they think about two, only for McCullum to send Ellis back at the last and he has to dive to make his ground
strays down the leg side again...
length ball outside off, waits on it and chops down to third man
angled in and drifting down the leg side for another wide
takes the pace off, but it sits up nicely on leg stump and McCullum shovels it past the man at 45 and away for four
full and straight, can't get under the ball but manages to squeeze it through midwicket for one more
pitched up on the stumps, nurdled to mid-on
good length ball in the corridor, Ellis deferentially defends into the off side

banged in, at the body and scooped out towards deep backward square, where Woakes takes a tumbling catch. Broad has picked up another wicket from judicious use of the short ball, Ellis tried to hook but it came off somewhere near the splice and didn't have the wings to clear the boundary
back of a length and wide of the stumps, hacked through the infield for a single
Mills on strike for his first ball, goes back and jams the bat down, squeezing it behind point
short and wide and McCullum has a yahoo at it but fails to connect - good over from Broad and the bell is tolling ever louder for NZ
pitched up and dropped short into the covers, they take the fielder on and grab one, the throw is high and wide at the bowler's end
touch short and wide, steered throguh point off the back foot for a comfortable run that takes McCullum to his third consecutive fifty of the series
length ball, outside off, chopped into the ground
maintains a disciplined line, played into the off side
good length outside off and Mills can't get it away
pitched up full and straight and trapped in front, Mills was stuck on the crease, hit on the back pad and that's a pretty straightforward one for the umpire
dug in and McCullum swivels with deadly intent to dispatch the ball over deep midwicket
length ball, worked toward mid-on
punched to mid-on to rotate the strike
steps away but manages only to hack the ball to mid-on
dug in short but Southee sees it big and rattles a pull shot away to the deep midwicket boundary
short of a length and outside off, waits on it and plays a late cut for four
pitched up and nudged into the covers
full again and drive back to mid-off
slower ball, McCullum can't get it away
nails this one, pitched up and smoked back down the ground for a flat six, stand-and-deliver stuff from McCullum, who's motoring just as New Zealand's tank is nearly empty
dropped short on the off side and McCullum wants a single to keep the strike, Woakes swoops but can't collect the ball cleanly and Southee makes his ground
round the wicket, tossed up but sliding down leg
on leg stump, tapped into the on side
full and on leg stump and that's in the slot for McCullum to thrash high over long-on
floated up towards off stump, McCullum tries to drive but can't get it through the infield
fired across wide of off, this time McCullum manages to get under a flat slap towards long-off, one bounce and it's four

short and shovelled out towards deep midwicket, looks like it's sailing for six only for Anderson to pluck the ball out of the air a yard in from the rope! McCullum departs after another defiant innings - he thought he'd cleared the man, there, but Anderson did really well to take the catch and keep his feet away from the boundary rope. McCullum shakes his head ... but without that knock, his side would have been long sunk by now

inn2.comm: England underway immediately as Cook clips down to long leg
back of a length outside off, Bell goes to force it away and doesn't time the stroke into the covers
full, just outside off stump, played back to the bowler
too straight, clipped down to long leg
and then doesn't adjust for the left-hander and Cook nudges a single through square leg
full and swinging down the leg side
full and swinging again, Cook forward and pushing towards mid off
Cook pushes a bit more firmly at this and hits the non-striker's end stumps
full andwell wide of off stump
full and wide again but Cook steers this past point and third man comes around to field
straighter and a better length, played back to the bowler
full of length again, just outside off, firm press to mid off
driven again to mid off but this time without the timing
full on the stumps, played back to the bowler
straight and Bell goes to drive off a good length and gets a big inside edge through square leg and it runs for four
back of a length just outside off, punched back to the bowler
foot outside off on a full length, left alone
lovely stroke this, picked up off a good length around off stump, Bell shuffled down the track a little and flicked handsomely over midwicket
fuller on off stump, played back to the bowler
pleasant drive through extra cover coming forward just outside off
too short and pulled over square leg, can't bowl that length at that pace
fuller on middle stump, tucked up to mid on
full and wide of off stump, ignored
off stump and full, timed push to mid off
full of length just outside off, essayed to cover
good length just outside off, press towards point
forward and pressed towards cover
lapped around the corner and beats long leg
leg side, only just
full and wide of off stump, Cook reaches out and drives in the air but in the gap between point and cover
angled across Cook who leaves alone
full and straight and whipped through midwicket, not perfectly timed
overpitched outside off and Bell creams this straight as an arrow, low back past Southee, even as he reaches out an arm to grasp thin air. That practically had smoke coming off it
short this time, goes back and across and plays a controlled pull out towards deep midwicket for a couple
pitched up in the channel, Bell is again on the move and pings a drive which Brendon McCullum, in the field, stops with a dive and a roll at mid-off
full and punched into a gap on the off side
shorter length, turned towards square leg
slanted across on a good length outside off, Cook shoulders arms
back of a length at the body, flicked nonchalantly for a couple off the hips
on the stumps, length ball, tapped short on the leg side

Bell pulls aerially and it sails down the throat of deep square leg! That's a soft way to go, it was a back-of-a-length ball that didn't get up all that much, Bell swished across the line, seemed to take his bottom hand off in the process, and a top-edge flew high and not-so-handsome straight into the safe hands of Rutherford
length ball on middle and off, Trott closes the face and taps this short of midwicket, they charge through for a very tight single
pushed across, short of a length and guided down to third man
stays back and defends into the on side
round the wicket to Cook, full and angled in, clipped off the pads to mid-on
right up in the blockhole, not quite yorker length but Cook drops his bat on it watchfully
angled in with the arm and prods towards mid-on
that's in Cook's slot, not overly wide from Southee but room for the arms to come scything down, whiplashing a cut shot through backward point
length ball, pushed back towards mid-on
a good ball to finish the over, another full-bunger but Cook is aware to the danger and digs it out
bit of width, length ball but Trott can't force his cut shot past the infield
pitched up, tighter to off stump, pushed back down the track
goes short, veering back in from outside off and Trott crouches out of the way
length ball, wide of the stumps, Trott cuts hard but into the ground and it bounces to backward point
goes across and opens the face, glancing the ball fine down to third man for a single
length ball angled across and tapped towards mid-off on the back foot
flat and around the line of off stump, goes across and tucks to leg
hangs back and plays a length ball towards mid-on
pushed through outside off, nudged into the covers coming forward
flat and angled in as Trott crabs forward and drags the ball towards midwicket
tries to attack again, leaving the crease and driving back, the ball skids into McCullum's hands and he shies at the stumps as Trott hastily attempts to regain his ground
tossed up on the stumps and he gets the sweep away through square leg for a solitary single off the over
fraction overpitched outside off and Trott showcases an immaculate cover drive, that was really well timed, weight over the ball and it scuttles away for four
straighter line, Trott goes across and works a length ball into a gap at midwicket
back of a length, turned into the leg side
slightly short and wide and Cook cracks a cut shot into the ground, but Kane Williamson dives athletically to stop the ball at point
short and on a leg-stump line, Cook rocks back to pull through square leg
full and straight and Trott leans on the ball, deflecting it through midwicket with a roll of the wrists
played back down the track
pushed through slightly wider, goes back and chops a single through point
floated up around off stump, gets down to paddle a sweep through square leg
round the wicket to Cook, tossed up and punched to cover on the front foot
wider and a touch short, Cook back-cuts through point
drags his length down, Trott comes forward and glances through midwicket from in front of off stump
floated up outside off stump and Trott adroitly reverse-sweeps fine, excellent improvisation and the ball races away for four
drops a little short and this time is cut through point off the back foot, though it doesn't get to the rope
round the wicket, tossed up and driven to cover
flatter, little bit of width and Cook chops a cut shot to the point fielder
pushed through wide of the stumps and this time Cook threads a gap with the cut
angled in towards the stumps, worked round the corner for another single
defended back to the bowler
tossed up and gently turning back in, played with the spin through midwicket to the sweeper
skids on towards the top of off stump, the batsman goes back and plays it late in front of point
floated up and worked to mid-on
gets forward and nudges the ball wide of mid-on, they push for one and get it
round the wicket, tossed up outside off, leans out and dabs into a gap between point and cover for another single
fullish and outside the line of off, played back down the pitch
pitched up and punched square on the off side
very full, tailing in towards off stump, blocked back towards the bowler
pitched up a little wide of the stumps, gets a stride out and taps into a gap towards cover-point
round the wicket for the left-armer, angling in towards off stump, blocked
length ball but drifting down the leg side, just a feather on it from Trott and that coerces the ball down to fine leg for four
pushed through around off stump, Cook props forwards and gets and inside edge to the leg side
on the stumps, turned off his pads
floated up and worked through midwicket on the front foot
touch wide and Cook plays a delicate late cut fine of short third man, excellent placement and that's four more
flatter, wide of the wicket and cut squarer this time for a single
angled in towards the stumps, turned into the leg side
length ball outside off, pushed back on the off side
slightly fuller, beginning to drift back a touch, Cook punches back to the bowler
pitched up outside the line of off, driven to the man at cover on the front foot
full and a little wider, Cook is drawn into driving and the ball skewers away through third slip area off the outside half of the bat, there's no one stopping that
pitched up and driven from outside off through the off side - that brings up the fifty partnership, from a respectable 62 balls
round the wicket to Trott, who waits on the ball and steers it down to third man
tossed up around off, shuffles across and works to leg
on the stumps, played back to the bowler
slides down the leg side, Cook gets a scrape of bat on the ball as he attempts to glance and it runs fine for a couple
pushed through and played back down the track
tossed up around off, blocked into the covers
straighter, pitching middle and leg, dabbed short on the leg side for a single
defended on the front foot
length ball outside off, pushed through the covers
length ball coming back in with the arm, blocked into the off side
slightly wide, played on the back foot with a angled bat for one to third man
searching for the yorker, this comes out as a low full toss but Cook is happy to block it into the off side ... one of those did get him out in the last match, after all
straighter line, worked towards mid-on
tossed up outside off, stabbed towards short third man
flatter and around off stump, nurdled into the leg side and that takes England to 100
worked off the pads to rotate the strike again
and he doesn't get it right this time either, short and wide, the ball stays a bit low but Trott watches it on to the middle of the bat and clumps it through the covers for four
pushed short on the off side, Cook yells "No!" to send Trott scampering back
angled in towards middle and off, worked through the leg side with a close of the bat face
length ball in the corridor outside off, steered towards point
touch short, Trott stays back and guides the ball down to third man for a single
hangs in the crease and taps through midwicket, B-Mac produces a slightly comic misfield but the mad coming in from the boundary keeps it to one
pitched up and played back to the bowler
banged in short, Trott is having none of it and ducks
shortish but this more of an armpit tickler and Trott flat-bats it round the corner

and there's an immediate breakthrough, Trott pushing indeterminately in the channel and thinning a catch through to Watling! He didn't really need to play at that delivery but, in his new-found spirit of enterprise, he tried to drive on the up and off he has to trot
pitched up outside off and met with a flowing drive that skims straight to mid-off
pitched up on off, steered towards point
wider and on a good length, played into the off side from the crease
banged in short and Root sways back to pull with a thunderclap over midwicket to the fielder in the deep
round the wicket to Cook, who edges across and flicks the ball to long leg for a single
line and length from Mills, blocked into the off side
tight line, Cook gets forward to push a length ball back down the track

angled across, little bit of room to swing the arms and Cook cuts to backward point where Kane Williamson fields, then loses the ball momentarily in attempting some sort of tricksy flick but it doesn't roll far and he can afford a sheepish grin
pushed across and punched on the up through the infield towards the cover sweeper
Root hangs back in the crease and defends outside off
full of a length, gets a stride in and punches back towards mid-off

Cook drives, gets a thickish edge and he's caught behind, England three down! Where did that come from? First Trott, now Cook, Southee strikes in consecutive overs, both times from a loose drive from England's too most choosy batsmen... Is the wobble on?
and there's another edge, Morgan feeling for a wide one and diverting it through second/third slip and down to third man
bit of width, maybe a touch short and Root seizes on to to slap a couple through cover-point
full and pushed towards mid-off on the front foot
pitched up in the corridor, Root connects nicely with a square drive but sends it racing to a fielder
length ball, wide of the stumps and guided down to third man for a single
short and wide and Root dismisses the ball to the boundary through backward point, rolls the wrists to keep on top of it, that's a gimme four but classily put away
pitched up outside the line of off, leans into a square drive towards point
hops back to a length ball around off stump and deflects it towards backward point
Mills goes wider on the crease and fires the ball in, Root defends on the back foot in front of the stumps
back and across and blocked again
full, pitching around off stump, taken towards mid-on coming forwards
defended in front of the stumps
back of a length and speared across, Morgan crouches and plays cross-batted, under-edging down on to the pitch and then out towards point
fuller, drifting across and asking Morgan to have a little nibble, like Trott and Cook before, but he leaves it well alone
tighter to the off stump, defended towards mid-off half forward
full and very wide, that releases the wee bit of pressure Southee was building up as Morgan reaches out to crunch a half-volley through extra-cover

Morgan goes hard at the ball again, fullish and pushed across outside off, he slices it but it gets plenty of air over the infield and out to a vacant area of the field at deep backward square for a second consecutive four
goes back and steers a short ball round the corner
full and around the line of off, carved to a fielder in the covers
dug in short, Morgan is in position quickly to crack a pull shot out to deep backward square
on the stumps, nudged into a gap on the leg side
length ball, Morgan works this through midwicket
pitched up around the line of off, pushed to mid-on
defended in front of the stumps
floated up in the slot outside off stump and clattered back high over long-off for six, bringing the target below fifty
tossed up a bit straighter, on-driven and there's a half-hearted dive from Mills at mid-on which fails to stop the ball - four more
pushed through, nudged into the covers
on the stumps, tapped towards cover
goes back and plays with the turn from outside off through square leg
stays in the crease and blocks into the off side
touch short, waits on it and nurdles through backward square leg
pushed across on a length, Morgan opens the face and steers to third man
tries the bouncer, sits up quite nicely and Root pulls into the ground through square leg
length ball on the stumps and Morgan practically mishits it for six, it doesn't quite go all the way out towards wide long-on, the bottom hand coming off the bat
goes short again, maybe takes the pace off a little, as Morgan gets through the pull shot early and the ball hits the toe of the bat and rolls towards point
pitched up and defended into the off side
length ball outside the line of off, gets across and blocks
slightly full and angling in, gets forward and driven into the covers
good line and length from Southee, keeping Root honest and the Yorkshireman gamely punches a drive to mid-off
slower ball this time, looping in around off stump, waits and blocks towards point
decent yorker to finish the over, shaping back and targeting the toes, Root gets his bat and squeezes the ball to midwicket
short of a length and width for Morgan to cut, he gets very low and bottom-edges through backward point
moves back and across and steers towards point
length ball, stays a bit low and defended in front of off stump on the back foot
short and veering towards leg stump, Root goes across his stumps and tries to scoop the ball towards fine leg but fails to connect
pushed back towards mid-off
length ball in the channel, Root pulls it through square leg to the man on the rope
good length, Root is hit on the knee roll trying to advance but the ball was sliding down leg
angled across and blocked into the off side
pitched up outside off, may as well have been put on a tee for Morgan, who Happy Gilmores it down the ground for a straight four
short of a length, on the stumps, Morgan adjusts and swats the ball behind square on the leg side with a horizontal bat
full toss and Root gets a bit of bat on it to send the ball to fine leg
called wide, maybe a little harsh, as the ball seemed to pass just inside the tramlines, with Morgan moving across at the same time but electing not to play a stroke
and the pain is redoubled for Southee, as Morgan latches on to a full, straight ball and bunts it into the crowd over deep midwicket
length outside off, worked through the leg side
full and wide, sprayed across and Morgan doesn't connect properly, dragging the ball low to mid-on

goes for the bouncer and Morgan clubs it out towards deep backward square leg, where Kyle Mills takes a magnificent leaping and manages to avoid stepping on the rope! Fine bit of work by the big man, who needed to be to pull that catch in
full and dipping in towards off, blocked
back of a length and pulled through midwicket, not much backlift but jabbed past the infield for three
length ball outside off, nudged towards mid-off from the crease
feisty bumper from Southee and Buttler saws himself in half to avoid it

another one down! Short again, this time Buttler has a crack at it but is late on the shot, it hits the splice and loops towards leg slip, where BJ Watling takes a diving catch, another excellent bit of work. That's three wickets for Southee but the dismissal was all about Watling scampering in like a golden retriever in pursuit of a stick to throw himself at full length under the ball
short and zinging through as Root pulls and misses, there's an appeal behind the stumps but no bat involved
dug in again, this time Root manages to get on top of it and hook one through square leg
stays back and steers a length ball towards gully
pitched up in the corridor outside off, punched to mid-off on the front foot
length ball on the stumps, worked off the pads towards fine leg and they hustle through for two
pitched up and coming back towards the stumps, deflected into leg side pushing forwards
short of a length, pulled through square leg off the back foot
stays back and steers into the off side
length ball outside off, prods into a gap square of the wicket, 10 required now
another bumper and Root roundhouses a hook shot through square leg for another single
clattered into the covers of the back foot
back of a length outside off, chops into the covers but again can't beat the infield
short, takes the pace off as well, Root pulls the man at deep backward square leg for one more
length ball, defended into the off side
gets on the front foot to block a good length ball in the corridor outside off
slightly wider on the crease and angled back in, Woakes covers up in front of the stumps
full and slightly wide, plays it from under his nose and fizzes a cover drive away to the rope
on the stumps, defended from the crease
goes back and across to clip a length ball from outside off towards mid-on
pushed across on a length, steered towards point on the back foot

slightly short of a length and played on the up towards mid-off, Root calls for the run immediately and Brendon McCullum has to collect and spin to throw with his right hand but it's not all that far away as Root slides in on his shirt front
gets across in front of the stumps and nudges through midwicket, they get back for two and the scores are tied
length ball, outside the line of off, steered towards point
pitched up, slightly wide of off, goes across and clips firmly to midwicket, where the fielder makes a sprawling stop
short and wide of the off stump, Root pulls through midwicket, keeping it down and they jog through for the required single, meaning England win by five wickets and take the series 2-1
